title: Special Place, don't miss
review: The atmosphere here is palpable. The energy of this saint is still very present. Take a moment to sit at the ghat and meditate.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: Very well maintained ashram. Sit sometime in the temple / courtyard and experience calmness. There is a shop which has books by swami Sivananda. There were many sadhaks /ashramites walking by when we were there but no one disturbed /questioned us.

title: Divine Life Experience - Divine
review: Though we had traveled on this route on many occasions and also visited the Ashram to purchase CDs and books, we had never stayed in the Ashram.. this visit was absolutely Divine right from our arrival at the Reception to our departure after 48 hours of peace, learning and tranquility..the daily program from 5am in the morning till 9.30pm at night is beautifully designed and implemented with great care and precision..each and every activity is conducted with love and compassion..we look forward to many more visits to this blessed serene environment

title: Spiritual Energy is Strong and Welcoming
review: The energy of the Ashram is strong and its people are welcoming. Went to a talk given in English and Hindi. The talk was given in a large auditorium and was open to the public. It was transformational for me in that it talked about existence and asking the right questions, like, instead of why? - who? I recommend checking out events going on when you are in town, even on a last minute basis. The Ashram also has a place for anyone to meditate silently.

title: Peace and Quiet
review: The resting place of Swami Sivananda.

title: Serene and beautiful Ashram near Ram Jhoola
review: We spend an hour in this ashram. The 2 things that caught our attention was a  large meditation hall in the area of the samadhi and another chanting room where 24/7 chanting takes place. The entire area is very neat and clean and well maintained . They seem to be having lots of programs and activities pertaining to spirituality and yoga.

title: Realistic Ashram/spiritual place in Rishikesh.
review: Sivananda ashram is the best place for spiritual touch, for Sadhan . It's a place where you can have reading of Sri Bhagvat Gita/upnishada/Yoga and spirituality

title: Head quarters for the  world famous Sivananda Ashram
review: This Ashram is located on the main road of Rishikesh  connecting lakhman Jhula and Ram Jhula. The steps to climb up starts from the very main Road itself.( Photos attached) When we visited all the locations in the Ashram no one prevented us or gave any instructions for our movements.

title: A visit to your inner self
review: Sivananda Ashram in all it's serenity is a place where when one gets reflective and meditative. One tends to reflect on oneself and it is a great learning atmosphere.

title: Visit to one of the most revered Ashrams in Rishikesh
review: It was great to set foot in to an Ashram where a great sage lived and helped humanity.  This was in my list for a long time. I was filled.

title: Serenity plus
review: Swami Sivananda's ashram is a genuine highlight of visiting Rishikesh.

title: Just a visit.....good place to meditate....
review: Sivananda ashram is walkable distance from Ram jhula, Rishikesh. We just visited to see around. There is a audio, visual section with lots of collection of audio cassettes to video CDs which you can watch on TV using headphones. There is a small temple where you can meditate or samadhi area where you can read history or life of swami sivananda, also you can meditate there. Around the ashram there are rooms where you can stay long and practice, also a dining hall with timings about food they serve.

title: A resting place of a saint
review: We went to Sivananda Ashram with one of our teachers for our evening meditation.

title: Old Rishikesh at it's holy best
review: One of the only places left in Rishikesh still uncontaminated by greed and commercialization. If you intend to stay here, it is by donation. You must reserve 3 months in advance. When in Rishikesh we eat here free of charge once a week. It is the most sattvic food in town. Unfortunately Yoga classes are only available to males at this location.

title: A Peace Seeker's Paradise
review: If you are seeking solitude, or in the quest for the meaning of your existence, or just looking for rejuvenating your life - this is the place to be at.

title: Power house of Rishikesh
review: Sitting in the place where holy Sivananda used to spend time, was thrilling and vibrating. The meditation hall is abundantly filled with positive energy.

title: peaceful
review: awesome location for an ashram..on the road going from ram jhula to laxman jhula, it is very serene and peaceful inside.

title: A must to see if visiting rishikesh.
review: Another must see and do whilst in rishikesh. Catch a tuck tuck, and go around ceremonial time when they start their own presession. I went with two other women and was welcomed in to join their mediation and offerings.

title: Deep traditional spirituality
review: Deep traditional spirituality.   There is a deep commitment to traditional Hindu spirituality and worship.  Virtually no accommodations to Westerners. It is open and offers free meals and yoga classes.   There’s only one yoga class for men and one for women offered each day. There were no women at the latest class and only three men. It seems that the practice of Asanas has fallen away. Even though I had little knowledge of Sanskrit, the spiritual energy was tangible. It’s definitely worth the visit. All of the worship services and satsangs are open.  Sivananda truly was a saint.

title: Spiritual
review: Neat and clean very spiritual feeling and one can elevate spiritually if spends time in the Ashram. Well motivated guides and staff, they take care of all needs.

title: very peaceful place
review: we stayed in shivanand ashram rishikesh in may 2017.The ashram is very peaceful, very clean and good place  for meditation. The meal served here is very simple and satvic. The ashram is situated just opposite to Ram jhoola .For rooms one has to book in advance .The rooms and meal are free of cost but it is advised to give donation as they run a trust hospital also.Must stay here for peace of mind

title: The Ashram of SHIVANAND MAHARAJ
review: This ashram was founded by SHIVANAND MAHARAJ and also serves as the Headquarters of Divine life Society. The Ram Jhula is nearby which forms the link and lifeline to the people on either banks of River Ganges.

title: good place
review: this is not a must visit place but if you have spare time you can visit and spend 2 to 3 hours with peace. visitvearly morning if you want to do yoga.

title: Visit this Historic Ashram
review: Swami Sivananda originated this ashram and is buried there.  This remains a working teaching school yoga.  Also known at the location of Swami Satchidananda teachings, who became the founder of Yogaville in Buckingham County, Virginia on the James River. Namaste, G

title: free yoga classes
review: very peaceful place. there are free yoga classes for men only. visit early morning will be great. very good ashram. you should visit one if you are there

title: A privilege to visit
review: Such an amazing ashram. Such devotion is shown to the memory of Swami Sivananda, it was amazing to witness and participate in guru puja.

title: Peaceful historic landmark
review: Serious yoga practitioners would have encountered the works and teachings of Swami Sivananda in spreading yoga at some point or other.

title: I had some very intense experiences in the Sivananda Baba ki Kutir
review: When i went into the bedroom I  saw Babaji- smiling from His radiant photograph- and you will not believe it Babaji kept on changing His expression particularly His eyes - from going upwards - to sideways to down all in one instant - i had not moved- this shows that this photograph of Babaji is very much alive - and we should cherish and treasure it always- we pray that Babaji will always bless me and my family always- hope to visit Rishikesh again as soon as possible - warm regards- hiro bachani

title: Very Calm and Good place for meditation
review: This Ashram is located very near to Ram Jhula. It is said that Swami Sivananda stayed here for more than 3 decades and had started this Ashram. Sivananda Ashram  conducts yoga classes everyday.except Sunday. Ashram has separate timings for men and women.. Meditation Classes and Pranayama classes are also available.

title: Joyous Experience
review: I visited the Ashram for little more than 2 hours on my recent trip to Rishikesh. The serenity of the place enthralls you as you climb up. The ashram is quiet and clean and has so many places where you can sit and contemplate or meditate.

title: Uplifting..
review: Very energetic place, very peaceful and beautiful. near to mother Ganga. blessed to be there. if you go there do not forget to buy swami ji's books. some great books by him are, Mind and its mysteries, thought power .etc.. Thank you.

title: Spiritual Place
review: Its peaceful and full of positive energy. A lot of tourists arrive here and its very close to the Ram jhoola ( Suspended bridge)

title: Be Good Do Good
review: This is one of the oldest Ashram along the bank of the Ganga, close to Ram Jhula (earlier known as Sivanand Jhula). The ashram was built by H H Sivanand Saraswati. It is a well maintained spiritual place.

title: One of the top Ashrams at Rishikesh
review: The Ashram is located near Ram Jhula adjoining the main road ; there is a bit of ramp walk to reach the main ashram , which is not very difficult for elders . It is a very well maintained ashram , has the samadhi of Swamy Sivananda with a large meditation halls . The temples inside are very good to see and pray .. The teachings of Swamy are very well displayed . Do not miss it , when in Rishikesh

title: Very nice spiritual place
review: It is possible to come to meditations, mantra chanting, yoge classess, to take part in puja, to participate in Ganga Arati, etc.

title: Historic
review: This is The place that made Rishikesh what it is today, on the banks of Ma Ganga a historic real ashram with Greta library. Many Swami and Sadwini's have come to find spiritual enlightenment here and felt inspired to write about their insights.

title: Old ashram must visit
review: Nice place to visit or stay. I went there for an hour. They have two temples inside the ashram and rooms to stay as well. Their library has good books to read.

title: Peaceful place
review: We visited the place for two hours . There is a temple where people can meditate and read about Shivananda's life. There is a bookhouse with books written on various subjects by Shivananda and a few others.  The ambience of the ahsram is good. Since we did not stay here, I am not sure about the aspects of the same.

title: Spritual place
review: We all liked visiting this ashram.  Although it is an old ashram but it is very peaceful.  we spent hours meditating here..

title: Abode of Peace
review: I have been waiting for this opportunity for many years and finally was blessed to visit Ashram, albeit a short one. It was a slightly damp and cool morning kindling even more the strong desire to reach the ashram quickly. The sprawling ashram was truly magical and inviting. Even spending a few moments at Guruji's mahasamadhi and listening to the japa was soul cleansing. Since the schedule was tight we had to reluctantly wrap up the visit and leave for the next destination. Hopefully, this was only a preview and will be blessed to come stay at the ashram in the future.

title: Very peaceful
review: Very peaceful place. Check the activities and opening timings before going there. There are free yoga classes for men and they should have for women as well (but not happening in March when I was there).

title: Peaceful
review: nice place. had the privilege of interacting with some very learned resident swamis of this ashram. recommended for yoga fans.

title: Peaceful and Disciplined ashram
review: First of all, its not an "Attraction" , its a holy place to visit.

title: Nice ashram. Real and good things inside.
review: Good ashram. In different temples in this ashram a lot of activities. You can be long time. If you want to sing Hare Krishna mantra, listen wisdom, be in Puja, no proble. There are a lot of space and places for that.

title: Great Gurus
review: Loved spending a few days at Shivananda. Learned people from around the world and is more like a Harvard of Yoga,

title: A little disappointed
review: I'm not sure what I was expecting but it was more 'business' like then I thought it would be. I was expecting the grounds to have more nature and less buildings as an ashram.

title: Powerful
review: Very beautiful energy you can feel as soon as you walk into the Temple. Wonderful books and CDS that we brought home to connect and enjoy.

title: Landmark not to be ignored
review: It's the biggest landmark ashram near the Ram Jhula, Diving Life Society gives you insight into the Indian spirituality and yoga. It is very popular among people wanting to explore the Indian Vedic culture.

title: Ashram of a Real Hindu Saint
review: Swami Sivanad established this ashram. This ashram is worth visiting if you are searching for understanding of Hindu religion.

title: Tranquility and spirituality blended into one
review: Located near the Ramjhula in Rishikesh, this famous ashram is hub of spiritual and religious activity. You can even stay here by booking well in advance. The place is very nice and you can join bhajans. There is Aarti in the evening as well. Good place if you are looking for spiritual atmosphere.

title: Holy place
review: It has a free hospital and accommodation. We can take bath in ghat in front of the ashram. Rudraksh tree is also there.

title: Spiritual vibrations of great Master!
review: Sivananda Ashram (Divine Life Society) is just off the Ganga at Rishikesh. It is only a few meters away from the Ram Jhula Parking lot. I visited while doing a course @ Ajarya in Narayan Kunj, Swargashram, Jonk on an Ashram visit as part my yoga ttc course. The Samadhi of Swami Sivananda, the library, the bhajan hall...everything about this place is serene! Time came to a standstill and my ideation withdrew!

title: Joyless Departure from Guru's Teachings
review: I am a follower of Sri Swami Sivanandaji Maharaj and spent a week at the ashram. The facilities are minimal and what one would expect at a traditional ashram and the temples and open spaces are very well maintained. However, in contrast to its founders loving message, the ashram felt joyless and uninspiring. It is more of a matha (monastery) that allows householders to live among sannyasis. There is no true ashram program or interaction between householders and sannyasis. In fact, very few sannyasis even attend the evening satsang. If you are simply looking to experience a hermitage, the Sivananda Ashram may be a good option. Notable, however, is its own beautiful ghat.

title: The best place to learn authentic yoga
review: Have visited this ashram and was good to see there are places still that are not commercial and are there to truly contribute to the society. You can learn authentic yoga in peaceful setting here.

title: as mesmerising as before
review: visited for  second time after a gap of almost three years and found the place to be every bit as mesmerising and enchanting as before.

title: Spiritual awakening
review: Sivananda Ashram are among the few places in Rishikesh, which dwell in a still dynamic and authentic spiritual atmosphere.

title: Massive ashram!
review: Knowledge based ashram, where they study the scriptures and give many talks. Some in English, some in Hindi. I absolutely loved their bhajan hall, and that energy in there was just something else! The samadhi hall is one of the biggest I've ever seen.

title: Sivananda Ashram Rishikesh - The Divine Life Society
review: As a family we have been visiting for the last 10 years and every time, we get rejuvenated by our trip to this Ashram. This is a serene Ashram run by the Sadhus, inmates of this Ashram. The neat and tidy environment adds to the pristine beauty of the nature, this Ashram is cradled by the Himalayas and the Mother Ganges. Must visit is the Samadhi Mandir of Swami Sivananda , a great saint who has simplified the way of life by his slogan - BE GOOD DO GOOD.

title: Do visit
review: I couldn't muster many religious feelings in Rishikesh as it was raining, we were all in roadside raincoats purchased for 20 rupees of cheap plastic and shabby fits, the crowd was literally walking on the top of other but the ashram offered a temporary respite.

title: Very serious Asrham
review: The ashram is a very serious place for Yoga and Spiritual development, since it has a big group of Monks living there. The chanting in the prayer room is an experience where you are asked to join in playing for the gods.

title: Yoga n spirituality at its best
review: Shivananda ashram is founded by Swami Sivananda, the well known spiritual guru of India. This place is near Ramjhoola. this place is best known for its spirituality n yoga n meditation. It also has a hospital, meditation centre, library.

title: Peaceful Ashram
review: The Ashram is located on top of a hill with a beautiful view. I came just in time for the women's chanting in the afternoon, and it was an inspiring experience- so peaceful, and the people there were very welcoming!

title: True Peace
review: the best ashram in Rishikesh. you can feel the peace as soon as you enter its gates. A great place for sincere seekers.

title: Great place for sadhana and practising yoga..
review: An extremely peaceful and calm ashram - great place for sadhana and practice yoga. Great library with some amazing books, very affordable. Stayed at this ashram 2 years ago. Was one of the best experiences of life.

title: Your search for true spiritualism ends here
review: I had the privilege to spent 3 days in sivananda ashram. The accommodation is simple and highly disciplined. Simple living and spiritual thinking is preached and practised in true sense. Would like to come again. Its very close to the river bank. Take a dip in river ganga and watch the natural beauty of rishikesh near the ashram.

title: If you go to Rishikesh, please consider a visit to Sivananda's Ashram!
review: An Ashram with a real "vibe" of Arsham !! Very clean, including the bathrooms ... at the reception was an older gentleman who was very kind and invited us to participate in Yoga (asanas) classes early in the morning and then stay for the breakfast. We also participated in a satsaunga with music/mantras and it was an interesting experience! :) But what I liked most was to see the hospital that the Ashram keeps working and attending to so many local people. :) Another amazing thing is the library they have. An impressive array of books at very cheap price, with genuinely interesting content!! I loved the experience and would recommend it to everyone into espirituality. Besides many of my friends already have told me to go there, I was waiting to long to have that experience.

title: holly and calm place
review: it is a holly place and yoga is taught free here.medical facilites are also free and good.satsung is also very good.

title: Sivananda Ashram  - We Had Our Yoga Courses
review: In summers I booked this place with my friends for some yoga sessions for well being. It is a nice place and has a positive effect on you. It is a well-disciplined place and has been maintained in the best possible manner. We loved staying at this place and enjoyed the views and the energizing air of the mountains.

title: Ideal Place for Sadhana
review: I have visited Sri Sivananda Ashram in December, 2014 and everything went according to plan - our registration, accommodation, meals and satsangs were well organised. The atmosphere is divine and conducive for sadhana. The inmates and swamis are very polite and accommodating. The food is sattwic and nourishing. If you plan a trip to India you must include Sivananda Ashram, Rishikesh in your itinerary. You will be thrice blessed, nay a thousand fold.

title: Beautiful place to see the beginning of rishikesh
review: This ashram started by swami sivananda is really the beginning so rishikesh. Expansive grounds,with daily yoga and discourses,rooms to let if your ashram type, not a holiday stay, serious only stay here and partake daily worship

title: GREAT PLACE TO DISCOVER, GOOD ENERGY
review: Had a great experience in attending the Night prayers session (satsang), early morning meditation session, a free lunch at its dining hall with hands on local simple food. A great place to discover spirituality, loving kindness, compassion and the teachings of Swami Sivananda.

title: Experience all Sivananda properties
review: After two months in Rishikesh, I've been to the Sivananda ashram and samadhi hall to meditate, to the Sivananda house and ghat for meditation and aarti, and to the Sivananda hut on the other side of the Ganga for meditation. Oh, and the book stall and the diorama of Sivananda's life. They are all well cared for, with a sense of reverence and appreciation for Sivananda and his remarkable influence and body of work. They have a clear spiritual atmosphere.

title: A place where my Guru lived..Swami Sivananda
review: The First ashram of Sivananda Organisation and a very known place .. the energy , the satsang and the positivity is outstanding.

title: Nice ashram
review: Nice to learn about Swami Sivananda. This is special ashram one of its own kind. I have seen multiple ashrams but none of them was as versatile as this one. If you want to stay in ashram and really want to experience ashram life this is the one you can try. Nice temple and the samadhi mandir.

title: Very peaceful and calm place
review: Have something in place..always feel calm and lifted after the visit. Shivananda and chidanada both devine figures ..place has lot to offer in area of meditation and yoga.the morning shiva abhishek puja is a must attend.

title: An ashram in true sense
review: Hari OM!

title: The most well known ashram
review: This is the best known ashram here . The sprawling Ashram named after the great Swami Shivanand is a symbol of this strength . I did not stay but the beauty it reflects in the books shop ,acomodation for the devotees and the meditation hall with the numerous pictures on the walls . The devotion to this great Guru still guides all those who come here . The dispensary accross the road from ashram treats the people .

title: By the river
review: The location of the ashram is excellent right by the river and would be a great place to stay if only they maintained the place properly. The ashram has a great book shop which you must browse if you are a reader and interested in Vedic philosophy.

title: I always feel touched when I stayed there
review: If you interested in yoga, meditation, practice yourself, spirit, consciousness....(all of them or one of them) you should visit there to take course or at least meditate in Swami Sivananada's samadhi hall. You'll benefit from it! They have small but holy and warm puja (I felt more than any other puja which nearby Ganga in Rishikesh) Sometimes one yogi chanting in front of samadhi, and some yogis come to walk around samadhi, it's very easy to feel the love and tradition between the master and followers. I always feel touched when I stayed there. Om

title: Most spiritual ashram in Rishikesh...
review: On one of my first trips to Rishikesh,  I was brought to the Shivananda ashram by my Indian colleague Dr Ram Sharma from Meerut.  We found a wonderful library and bookstore... the library alone is reason to come since it houses so many Vedic texts... the temple is always having pujas and the sadhana (meditation) hall is also open in the mornings especially from 11-12 noon... recently we discovered a view of the Ganga in the front of the ashram that we feel is one of the best in Rishikesh

title: Excellant
review: 1. With all the divine will the place is excellent.

title: A Must visit for spiritual progress...
review: I really enjoyed the 5am silent meditation followed by the chanting/worship. I wish I could have stayed at the ashram and done the evening Satsang (in english)!

title: A divine place to be with oneself
review: It has all it needs to enable oneself to surrender himself of all material things and to be at peace with oneself. A good place to meditate and the five minutes i sat in silence gave me such immense strength to find my inner self. I wish I could have stayed and spend several hours to just meditate in silence. It was sheer bliss.

title: Love the sivananda ashrams
review: I spent much of my childhood at the sivananda ashram in the bahamas. This, the original, is such a fantastic place of calm where people from all over the world interact. Great for those pursuing meditation and spirituality.

title: Temple to Yoga
review: This ashram was founded and dedicated to bring the wisdom and knowledge to many. Millions probably, have benefited over the years to be students of details of yoga practices taught by masters here. Many bows for this holy and loving service. Ann G.

title: Lovely, quiet place, mean-spirited, rude swamis!
review: What else is there to say, really.

title: A real ashram
review: Loved this place and the spiritual vibrations in it.

title: Interesting if you are involved in meditation
review: People was very opened and fiendly. The Ashram has a nice library and a publishing nearby. It is a very peaceful place.

title: Inspiration from a great saint!
review: Sivananda was a great saint in this land! You must go for a visit to see what a noble man did in his life. There are many available books you can purchase and learn from this master. And if you have luck, you can see horn-birds in the trees.

title: Wonderful
review: A must visit to see the original heart of the city. Rich in knowledge and a great book shop. Arati in Masters house. Chanting in the masters house. A true divine flame can be felt.

title: Gurudev's Presence and Blessings
review: The tranquility of Gurudev's ashram is absolute bliss. The swamis and ashram residents are so accommodating when you have to offer your pujas. my mum sprained her ankle - they immediatley assisted at the ashram's clinic. they provide the most delicious meals and the presence of Gurudev is there. for us it was a privilege and blessing to have had the opportunity to visit the ashram. they do wonderful charity work for the upliftment of the people- truly a spiritual place

title: The real divine experience
review: You won't get what you usually get in ao many other Ashram where only business is done. Here, In Shivanand Ashram, you will find more discipline, very good environment for meditation and peace.

title: Extraordinary place--truly divine ambience !
review: One of the oldest religious/spiritual places in Rishikesh--and the home to many spiritual leaders over the generations !   Fantastic discipline and service within the campus--very clean, and silent---the place is great for meditation !  Surely must be visited---with time to spare to sit and meditate and pray--not just walk through and walk away !

title: Great spiritual center
review: I wish to come here for a yoga course, and visited their office and ashram. very intelligent people there and brilliant books and spiritual material available

title: Best place for Yoga courses
review: This is the best and most reputed place for non commercial yoga courses in Rishikesh. Great people and great Aashram. Am coming here for sure this year.

title: Special Place, don't miss
review: The atmosphere here is palpable. The energy of this saint is still very present. Take a moment to sit at the ghat and meditate.

title: Great, but not for a stay unless…..
review: Swami Sivananda was one of the true Greats. His ashram is still a very good place in many ways, but it is very large and full of rules that many foreigners find hard to deal with. (Plus, at least a few times fellow foreigners proved to be thieves. Keep you doors locked.)

title: Divine Life Experience - Divine
review: Though we had traveled on this route on many occasions and also visited the Ashram to purchase CDs and books, we had never stayed in the Ashram.. this visit was absolutely Divine right from our arrival at the Reception to our departure after 48 hours of peace, learning and tranquility..the daily program from 5am in the morning till 9.30pm at night is beautifully designed and implemented with great care and precision..each and every activity is conducted with love and compassion..we look forward to many more visits to this blessed serene environment

title: Spiritual Energy is Strong and Welcoming
review: The energy of the Ashram is strong and its people are welcoming. Went to a talk given in English and Hindi. The talk was given in a large auditorium and was open to the public. It was transformational for me in that it talked about existence and asking the right questions, like, instead of why? - who? I recommend checking out events going on when you are in town, even on a last minute basis. The Ashram also has a place for anyone to meditate silently.

title: Peace and Quiet
review: The resting place of Swami Sivananda.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: Very well maintained ashram. Sit sometime in the temple / courtyard and experience calmness. There is a shop which has books by swami Sivananda. There were many sadhaks /ashramites walking by when we were there but no one disturbed /questioned us.

title: Serene and beautiful Ashram near Ram Jhoola
review: We spend an hour in this ashram. The 2 things that caught our attention was a  large meditation hall in the area of the samadhi and another chanting room where 24/7 chanting takes place. The entire area is very neat and clean and well maintained . They seem to be having lots of programs and activities pertaining to spirituality and yoga.

title: Realistic Ashram/spiritual place in Rishikesh.
review: Sivananda ashram is the best place for spiritual touch, for Sadhan . It's a place where you can have reading of Sri Bhagvat Gita/upnishada/Yoga and spirituality

title: Serenity plus
review: Swami Sivananda's ashram is a genuine highlight of visiting Rishikesh.

title: Visit to one of the most revered Ashrams in Rishikesh
review: It was great to set foot in to an Ashram where a great sage lived and helped humanity.  This was in my list for a long time. I was filled.

title: A visit to your inner self
review: Sivananda Ashram in all it's serenity is a place where when one gets reflective and meditative. One tends to reflect on oneself and it is a great learning atmosphere.

title: Divine Life Experience - Divine
review: Though we had traveled on this route on many occasions and also visited the Ashram to purchase CDs and books, we had never stayed in the Ashram.. this visit was absolutely Divine right from our arrival at the Reception to our departure after 48 hours of peace, learning and tranquility..the daily program from 5am in the morning till 9.30pm at night is beautifully designed and implemented with great care and precision..each and every activity is conducted with love and compassion..we look forward to many more visits to this blessed serene environment

title: Special Place, don't miss
review: The atmosphere here is palpable. The energy of this saint is still very present. Take a moment to sit at the ghat and meditate.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: Very well maintained ashram. Sit sometime in the temple / courtyard and experience calmness. There is a shop which has books by swami Sivananda. There were many sadhaks /ashramites walking by when we were there but no one disturbed /questioned us.

title: Spiritual Energy is Strong and Welcoming
review: The energy of the Ashram is strong and its people are welcoming. Went to a talk given in English and Hindi. The talk was given in a large auditorium and was open to the public. It was transformational for me in that it talked about existence and asking the right questions, like, instead of why? - who? I recommend checking out events going on when you are in town, even on a last minute basis. The Ashram also has a place for anyone to meditate silently.

title: Peace and Quiet
review: The resting place of Swami Sivananda.

title: Serene and beautiful Ashram near Ram Jhoola
review: We spend an hour in this ashram. The 2 things that caught our attention was a  large meditation hall in the area of the samadhi and another chanting room where 24/7 chanting takes place. The entire area is very neat and clean and well maintained . They seem to be having lots of programs and activities pertaining to spirituality and yoga.

title: Realistic Ashram/spiritual place in Rishikesh.
review: Sivananda ashram is the best place for spiritual touch, for Sadhan . It's a place where you can have reading of Sri Bhagvat Gita/upnishada/Yoga and spirituality

title: Serenity plus
review: Swami Sivananda's ashram is a genuine highlight of visiting Rishikesh.

title: Visit to one of the most revered Ashrams in Rishikesh
review: It was great to set foot in to an Ashram where a great sage lived and helped humanity.  This was in my list for a long time. I was filled.

title: A visit to your inner self
review: Sivananda Ashram in all it's serenity is a place where when one gets reflective and meditative. One tends to reflect on oneself and it is a great learning atmosphere.
